column4: No, it doesn't in Windows XP. I am using a Comtrend 536+ multiport router.
I tried sudo ifconfig eth0 down ... and then ifconfig eth0 up ... and it doesn't work.
have you enabled azureus ports in virtual servers ?
in your router ?
is your router also a dhcp server ?
then you need to configure a static ip address
sudo ifconfig eth0 192.168...  netmask 255.....  eth0 up
and when you ifconfig it shows the proper ip address ? and netmask ?
whats your router ip ?  and your static ip ? and the netmask ?
seems good
from windows it works fine ?
or other OS ?
yea, well if from windows it worked, it's not a tier 1 problem, in other words, hardware is fine
you should be able to ping your router with:  ping 192.168.1.1
did you try to enable dhcp on your router ? and leave your card on roaming mode ?
i have router works fine for me
and i have dhcp enabled... , but it's still weird, seems sort of like a time out problem
check if your router doesn't have any timeout events enabled
does this only happen when azureus is launched or bittorrent ?
heh... ok , yea then network should be fine
i would say to check on the enabled virtual servers and see if the ports are enabled for your host and forwarded properl
properly
